edge: Udham was part of the HSRA in his past.
Udham assassinated Michael O'Dwyer due to his role in suppressing a major uprising in Punjab.
Udham made his way to Caxton Hall where O'Dwyer was giving a speech about his time as Lt. Governor of Punjab.
Udham is in London during the present timeline.
Udham was released from prison in India.
Udham made his way to London via the Soviet Union during winter.
The British authorities were constantly watching Udham in India and London.
A lawyer was appointed to Udham during his trial.
The judges sentenced Udham to death.
Udham delivered an impromptu speech denouncing British rule in India and reaffirming his support for the Indian freedom movement.
Udham protested against the conditions of his detention.
In favour of O'Dwyer, General Dyer opens fire on a crowd of 20,000 peaceful protestors inside Jallianwala Bagh.
General Dyer opens fire on a crowd of 20,000 peaceful protestors inside Jallianwala Bagh, resulting in a massacre.
Udham hears about the massacre and rushes to the grounds to help.
Along with a few other volunteers, Udham finds survivors and gets them to a makeshift hospital which is overwhelmed itself.
Udham has a photo of Bhagat Singh, taken when Bhagat was in prison during his final days.
Dyer gives his own account to the Hunter Commission.
O'Dwyer gives his own account to the Hunter Commission.
